channel.title: next on Datafortress.cloud
channel.description: Recent content in next on Datafortress.cloud

item.title: Tech NEWS 2022-02-02
item.description: Gmail’s next big redesign starts rolling out next week (3 minute read) Google is rolling out its integrated view Gmail redesign next week.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-11-15
item.description: Tesla starts deploying Starlink satellite internet systems at Supercharger stations (2 minute read) Tesla has started to deploy Starlink antennas at its Supercharger stations.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-09-14
item.description: Zoom is adding live translation services and coming to Facebook VR (2 minute read) Zoom plans to add real-time transcription for up to 30 languages and real-time translation across as many as 12 languages by the end of next year.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-06-25
item.description: Microsoft is bringing Android apps to Windows 11 with Amazon’s Appstore (2 minute read) Windows 11 will be able to run Android apps natively.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-05-31
item.description: Nvidia is making a 3D map of the universe with the world’s most powerful AI supercomputer (2 minute read) Nvidia’s Perlmutter supercomputer is the fastest in the world for AI workloads.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-05-10
item.description: Elon Musk’s SpaceX is literally launching a Dogecoin-funded satellite to the Moon (2 minute read) SpaceX is now accepting Dogecoin.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-04-26
item.description: Disney Imagineering’s Project Kiwi is free walking robot that will make you believe in Groot (1 minute video) Project Kiwi is a small-scale, free-roaming robotic actor developed by Disney’s Imagineers.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-11-27
item.description: Salesforce is in talks to buy Slack, deal could be announced next week (2 minute read) Slack shares closed almost 38% higher on Wednesday after it was reported that Salesforce was in talks to acquire the company.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-08-07
item.description: Trump signs orders banning US business with TikTok owner ByteDance and Tencent’s WeChat (4 minute read) President Donald Trump has signed an executive order banning transactions with ByteDance and WeChat.
